alert.note: Alert for Boone; Cabell; Jackson; Kanawha; Lincoln; Mason; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gallia, southeastern Lawrence, southern Mason, Cabell, Kanawha, Putnam, northern Lincoln, southwestern Jackson and northern Boone Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 1014 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tornado, or 7 miles east of Hamlin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Huntington, Nitro, Winfield, Hamlin, Proctorville, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Barboursville, Sissonville, Milton, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Belle, Buffalo and Cedar Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 124. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 12 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 74 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 52 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
